name: Wo Hop
address: 17 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text:
Es un lugar muy √∫nico! La comida es deliciosa y cuantiosa, la atenci√≥n es r√°pida. El pago es en efectivo pero tienen un cajero justo a la entrada jaja
Me encant√≥!! Gran lugar para comer en el barrio chino.

Wo Hop, c‚Äôest le classique de Chinatown‚ÄØ: petit restaurant old‚Äëschool en sous-sol avec un service rapide, des portions g√©n√©reuses et un riz saut√© (et chow mein) au top. Les prix sont raisonnables et si vous n‚Äôavez pas d‚Äôesp√®ces, un ATM se trouve juste √† c√¥t√© de la porte d‚Äôentr√©e. Bref, un incontournable pour manger vite et bien‚Ä¶ avec le sourire en prime‚ÄØ!
The food tasted burnt and the wings were the only things cooked correctly.

Ordered the pineapple duck, was very flavorful albeit a tad bit too sweet. Was a fan of the chicken chow mein however, will be back to try out more of the menu. The waiters were very attentive as well
Great food
Petit coin √† Chinatown o√π on mange tr√®s bien et pour pas cher. Le personnel pas tr√®s sympathique par contre.
I‚Äôve been eating here since the 80s üëå
I‚Äôm not very familiar with Asian cuisine, and this is my second time in New York, but I honestly can‚Äôt remember the last time I had duck this delicious!

Authentic chinese restaurant it's a small, cash only local icon down a sketchy looking set of stairs in the basement lol. We went at lunch and the place was packed with older local Chinese men eating, which tells you about all you need to know about the food it was amazing super authentic we loved it for the food and the experience. 100% recommend!
I don't like waiting on line but here it's  an exception. Best authentic Chinese food in the city.

We were eating lunch early so we stopped in here. We only had BBQ ribs appetizer - excellent - and chicken chow foun - large portion, also excellent. Huge menu. Fast and friendly service. Price was reasonable. Highly recommended!
This place is amazing and the customer service is super great.

I am a born and bred New Yorker. I have never heard of this place until a friend told me recently. I did research and the reviews were off the charts.

I went there the other day and there was a line 10 people deep to get in. This is the worst Chinese food I ever had and the service was terrible.

The waiter was rude and did not even bring us fried noodles. I ordered an Egg Roll and Fried Pork Dumplings to test the place out. The Egg Roll was small and skimpy and the Fried Dumplings? They looked like small empanadas!  How in the world does this place get thousands of positive reviews is mind boggling.

I would never eat here again. "1 Star" is too high of a rating for them. The best Chinese restaurant in New York is in Wantagh, Long Island called "Kwong Ming."  Their Egg Rolls are huge and the food is fantastic.

"Wop Hop? NO MORE!!!"
Very sad. Excellent food but Waiter keeps all change as tips without even asking for bad service.

What a classic nyc Chinese restaurant! Very cool atmosphere. The service is quick and servers are super nice. The fried rice was incredible and the veggies but the pineapple duck wasn‚Äôt good! It was super sweet and the pink sauce definitely doesn‚Äôt help. Maybe next time will get classic dishes not some sort of specials.
Great place
Very good
Great good with typical Chinatown service.

Amazing
Prostƒõ skvƒõl√©
Salt & pepper wings were very good.

Still the great food it has always had.  But if you get the opportunity, sit in the downstairs dining room. It was too crowded when I got there so we had to sit in the new room upstairs at street level.  Same kitchen, so same great food, but all the ambience is to be found in the downstairs room.  That's where you want to be to get the real Wo Hop experience.
Very mid
Mid
Scheinbar sehr beliebt. Meine dumplings fand ich jetzt nicht so . Aber die Nudeln waren gut.

My favorite place forever, just authentic & nostalgic‚Ä¶please stay open later!
Miss the 4am closing timeüòåüôÑ
Back in the day, (90‚Äôs, don‚Äôt guess my age) during the AOL messaging days my screen name was BEANWOHOPü•≥
Still cash only ü•µ
Traditional chinese cantonese food

Sehr nettes kleines China-Restaurant.
Eher ein chinesischer Schnellimbiss als ein Restaurant in dem man sich l√§nger aufh√§lt. Der Eingang f√ºhrt eine Treppe hinunter in den Keller. Hier findet man viele Sitzpl√§tze vor, etwas beengt aber durchaus sehr nett. Dieses Restaurant hat wohl einen gro√üen Fanclub. Davon zeugen die vielen 1-Dollar-Geldscheine die an der Wand geklebt sind, alle mit einer kleinen Signatur. Das Essen wurde sehr schnell serviert und hat uns sehr gut geschmeckt. Nur Barzahlung m√∂glich, es gibt aber einen Geldautomaten vor dem Eingang..
Zusammenfassung:
- kleines Restaurant im Keller
- etwas eng aber durchaus gem√ºtlich
- sehr laut, die K√ºche ist direkt daneben
- ideal f√ºr eine schnelle und leckere Mahlzeit
- keine Kartenzahlung
- nicht barrierefrei
- auch vegane, vegetarische Gerichte
- sehr preiswert
- Service etwas wortkarg aber freundlich
- sollte man mal gesehen haben
üî•üî•üî•üî•üëåüëåüëå I love their selection on their menu general tso is bomb‚Ä¶
Love this place

This is by far the best chinese food I ever had. I thought Baji Baji and Brooklyn Chop was good. This is the best. I've been everywhere and today 10-3 25 was the first time I went here the Chicken and Broccoli with Shrimp Fried Rice was amazing. Real Chicken. The BBQ Spare ribs were so good. I'll be back on the regular. Go early it gets real crowded.
Dumplings 10/10

Food had no flavor and plates tasted the same. Waiters  wear dirty uniforms and they clean tables with a dirty rag. They are also not very kind when taking orders I wanna think i didn‚Äôt understand them. The only thing we liked was the wonton soup. No space between
tables.

In response to the restaurant saying you guys don‚Äôt have waiters. Should I post a picture?
My review is not erroneous, your food has no flavor. Recognize mistakes and fix them so your business succeeds. Wear black uniforms instead of light blue and have clean rags.

Upon first glance this looks like the type of place to walk right past. But we have found that these places are often the best. Great service, we were welcomed with smiles and never had to ask for anything. The food was delicious and piping hot. We shared this plate of Lo Mein between the two of us and it was plenty.
Buena comida china, solo qu√© hay que esperar bastante para tener una mesa dentro del restaurante. A pesar de eso la comida llega r√°pido!

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience, serving delicious meals in generous portions that truly satisfy. The atmosphere is welcoming, and you won't feel shortchanged when it comes to the quantity of food on your plate.
Food is always decent. This is our go to Chinese restaurant every time we go to New York's Chinatown.  This is our favorite waiter, Tom giving up üëç
Fantastic food at a fantastic price. One of our faves in NYC. We go back everytime we visit.
Perfect
Great, classic Chinese food!
Omg! Best food, best service

It is said that the Chinese restaurant known to New Yorkers is famous for a TV play. It tastes good and is not salty. The waiters are old men from Guangdong„ÄÇÊçÆËØ¥Á∫ΩÁ∫¶‰∫∫ÈÉΩÁü•ÈÅìÁöÑ‰∏≠È§êÂéÖÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÁîµËßÜÂâßËÄåÈóªÂêçÔºåÂë≥ÈÅì‰∏çÈîôÔºå‰∏çÂí∏ÔºåÊúçÂä°ÂëòÈÉΩÊòØÂπø‰∏úËÄÅÂ§¥
I ordered beef fried rice. No egg, no vegetables and very very little beef. I got   5 dollar worth of food and was charge 12 dollars. Not recommended at all
Loved it! Great value. Friendly people.

Sch√∂nes kleines chinesisches Restaurant nicht alle Kellner sprechen gut englisch. Das Steak war super das lemon chicken hat mir nicht so geschmeckt der Rest war super. Es war auch vom Preis/Leistung super.

Had the pleasure of dining here with my wife and we loved it. The staff was super friendly, the food came out quickly, and everything was absolutely delicious. Definitely a spot I‚Äôd recommend to anyone.‚Äù
One of the best chinese restaurants in the city!
The best chinese food in all of chinatown manhattan.

Wo Hop is a true NYC classic and absolutely worth the visit. The beef chow fun is amazing, but don‚Äôt sleep on the vegetable dishes ‚Äî the Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce and the green beans with black bean sauce are outstanding. The egg rolls are just right, and the pork fried rice is excellent. Add in the old-school staff who keep things moving with charm, and you‚Äôve got one of the best Chinatown dining experiences around. A legendary spot that always delivers!

Comida muy muy abundante, recomiendo pedir poco a poco ya que son bandejas con much√≠sima cantidad.
La comida es buena aunque le faltaba un poco de sabor, en general estaba bien.
El agua fr√≠a entra en el precio.
Relaci√≥n calidad precio muy bien.
El sitio es muy limpio, buen ambiente y un servicio excelente.
We called ahead and they made seating for 30 of us in the upstairs dining area.  Our waiter Danny was amazing. The food was good and the service was Fantastic. Worth making the trip to Chinatown.

Decent food- we got the beef chow fun and mixed mushrooms with vegetables. The food was okay for the price, but kind of bland. The mushrooms tasted old. As we came near closing we were rushed by the waiter, who ultimately packed our food without letting us finish. At least the portion sizes were big!

Great authentic Chinese cuisine. Staffs were nice and friendly. Little long wait at night for dinner. Cash only but there was an ATM at door LOL. Suitable for all group sizes, even an individual just want to enjoy the meal.

Chinatown classic staple. You never been to Chinatown if you haven‚Äôt dined at Wo Hop. Upstairs or downstairs, same quality of food; but the downstairs vibes are leveled up. The food here is consistent of old school Cantonese style cuisine. Some dishes can be super greasy for those unfamiliar but that‚Äôs it needs to be for the ‚Äúwok hay‚Äù aka flavor. Cash only, but there‚Äôs an ATM nearby. Sucks that they close early now (10pm) because this place to used to be popping 3am-4am serving the drunk after party crowds. Can‚Äôt go wrong with any dish but definitely go with their beef chow fun, Singapore Mei fun, razor clams, chicken wings, and hot and sour soup!

Great, old school Chinese restaurant. Enter the basement restaurant via the stairs. Cash only. Fast service. Excellent menu with reasonable prices. Everything we tried was delicious, including steamed dumplings, fried dumplings, duck with flat noodles, and Szechuan shrimp. Water and hot tea free. Soft drinks are available for purchase. No alcohol. ATM on-site.

From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere feels warm and welcoming. The walls are covered with police, fire department, and military patches, instantly giving the place a unique and local vibe. One of the coolest traditions is that guests can leave a signed dollar bill on the wall, adding a personal touch that makes the experience truly unforgettable.

The food was absolutely delicious, with the meat being a real highlight‚Äîtender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. The portions were generous, making the price-quality ratio more than worth it. On top of that, the staff was incredibly friendly and funny, creating a laid-back and enjoyable atmosphere.

At first, I was a bit skeptical, wondering if this was just another overhyped spot. But from the service to the food to the overall experience, it exceeded all expectations. Without a doubt, I‚Äôll be coming back!

We had high expectations since we kept seeing an extraordinary line wrapped around the block when we passed by - so we tried for a late lunch on Saturday - short line, still robust crowd, asking our fellow line waiters ‚Äúwhy Wo Hop?‚Äù  ‚Äútik tok!‚Äù
We had the salt and pepper shrimp, the ginger and scallion lobster and eggplant in a garlic sauce. The shrimps were regular size (not jumbo, the lobster was good - fresh scallions and ginger - and the eggplant mushy and just not super attractive. Overall, the food was okay. The servers were attentive and prompt but when we asked clarity questions about the lobster dishes, we didn‚Äôt get any additional information on ‚Äúone sauce and another sauce.‚Äù I asked if the eggplant was fried - ‚Äúit comes in a black bean sauce or garlic sauce‚Äù so not answering my question- it‚Äôs not fried.
The fried dumplings looked really good, they were pork so we didn‚Äôt order but if you go, and can eat pork, they looked good!
Wo Hop is a different restaurant than Wo Hop Next Door. Also, they charge $1.50 for white rice üçö with your meal and like most others, only take cash. Overall, the food was okay, the ambiance was great - lots of people enjoying the experience and the feeling that excitement was happening around us was good. There are so many choices on that block of Mott street, I‚Äôd personally go to Hop Lee or Hop Kee on the same block before Wo Hop for the good food over an okay, TikTok experience. Will try Wo Hop Next Door soon.

Wo Hop downstairs was always a staple in college. The quality of the food has not changed and the prices are relatively very inexpensive. The service is always excellent and you always leave with a full meal to take home even though the portions are huge.

Great food and very authentic flavors! The vibe is cool, and the interiors are thoughtfully done ‚Äî really impressive. The only downside was the staff, who could be a bit more welcoming and attentive. That said, the food truly made up for it.

This place in China town is a must go. The service was top-notch and the ambience was great. Though the space looks small but it sure is cozy. The food was delicious and I enjoyed it. I recommend Choosing one dish for a couple and take it from there as the food portions are big. I recommend it.

Authentic American Chinese food.
The only thing that has changed here is the wait. Came on a Friday evening in the summer, 30-60 minute wait. All due to the internet.
We ordered the Wonton soup, Hot n Sour, Sweet n Sour Chicken, Beef Pan Fried noodles & Fried Rice. Chicken dish too sweet for mua. Rest excellent. Only in NYC üá∫üá∏

I dont understand the high rating of this restaurant and how they said that the food were great.  We ordered the salt and pepper porkchop, the pork had a weird taste, it seemed that the pork were no longer fresh and tough.  Then the shrimp canton noodles and yang chow fried rice, though they looked dark from the soy sauce it tasted bland.  You can also tell that the shrimps that they used were frozen ones.  Then lastly the lobster with ginger sauce.  This one we felt that we got ripped off. We first ordered for the crab with ginger sauce. It cost around $20.  Then the waiter told us that they no longer had the crabs and only the lobsters were available.  We asked how much was it and said it was $35. So we ordered that.  When it was served, half of it were CRABS!! and there was only 1 small lobster which they cut into 4 small pieces.  I felt we were deceived on this for us to pay a higher price. (You can check the pictures and try to find the lobster in it). If they no longer have crabs, why is it that we have it on the lobster??  Anyways the only consolation that we got was that the sauce was good.  We were dismayed because a lot of people were praising this resto for good chinese food and yet our experienced were the opposite.

A very poor example of authentic Chinese food‚Ä¶as it should be. It was intended, when it opened decades ago, to intentionally ‚Äúwesternize‚Äù (bastardize) traditional Chinese food to appeal to less open minded American palates. I made a simple order to take home pork fried rice, 2 egg rolls & an order of fried dumplings. $48! The dumplings were more like a Jamaican pastry dough. Way too much dense dough and nothing like the typical thin wok fried wrap that browned nicely.  The contents had decent flavor. The egg rolls were passable. The pork fried rice was pretty flavorless & had no peas.

Overall, I will miss nothing by not returning and happily surrender Wo Hop to the tourists who don‚Äôt know any better.
The place is unusual for its small size, adult waiters, atmosphere and food. The place is overrated, the food is ordinary and tasty, nothing special. Good portion sizes.

Wo Hop/General Tao‚Äôs Chicken:
This location is known for its stairway entrance and walls adorned with dollar bills; talk about bringing lots of luck!  The service was lightning fast and the portion was plentiful, but I can‚Äôt say I felt lucky.  The sauce and seasonings had a bland, dull taste.

Wo Hop is a classic Chinatown experience
that absolutely lives up to its legendary reputation! After perusing the other rave reviews, we were eager to try it, and we were not disappointed. We ordered the Szechuan beef and the pork fried rice, and both dishes were outstanding. The Szechuan beef was perfectly spicy and incredibly flavorful, with tender slices of beef and a vibrant mix of vegetables. It had that authentic kick that really makes a Szechuan dish sing.
The pork fried rice was equally impressive ‚Äì a generous portion packed with flavor, tender pieces of pork, and perfectly cooked rice. It wasn't greasy at all, which is always a plus, and it paired wonderfully with the boldness of the Szechuan beef. What truly elevated our experience, however, was the excellent service. Our server was attentive, friendly, and efficient, making sure we had everything we needed without being intrusive.
The ambience is exactly as described ‚Äì that quintessential New York basement-style restaurant with a no-frills, bustling atmosphere. It's part of the charm and history of Wo Hop, and it adds to the overall authentic feel. It's not about fancy decor; it's about fantastic food and solid service. Wo Hop is a true Chinatown institution that delivers on taste and experience. If you're looking for delicious, no-nonsense Chinese food in a classic setting, this is the place to go. We can't wait to return!

Old school Americanized Chinese restaurant serving an extensive list of classic dishes. The salt and pepper squid was excellent with a light fry and chiles to add some spice. The chicken was solid, cooked well with a gravy like sauce

So good I went day after day!
A great atmosphere in a small basement with a lot of great meals.
I took the chicken and corn soup and duck which was very good. The second day I took the sweet and sour soup and sweet and sour chicken (the best meal out of the four).
Would definitely recommend!

Food: 5- AMAZING. PERIOD.
Service: 5- Staff is older and very experienced. Very on par with the type of service you receive in Chinatown.
Atmosphere: 4- The restaurant is EXTREMELY SMALL, so if you're very tall or very wide, you will have some issues as it's in a small basement room that fits about 50 people, maybe? You will be pretty close to the next group.  A lot of memories in the form of pictures or signed dollar bills on the walls.
The staff is very polite. The food was also amazing! I only managed to take a picture after I ate half of it because it was so tasty. The atmosphere was very cozy

Thanks to Deepseek, an incredible find. This little HK styled restaurant is an institution! I came for their beef chow fun! Texture, colour and taste is exactly on point! Can‚Äôt wait to try their other offerings!

Classic spot in Manhattan‚Äôs Chinatown for a meal. While a bit small and dated, the service and quick the food gives good value for money. Come here with a group and order a variety. Don‚Äôt be intimidated by the waiters - they are actually very friendly if you ask them for recommendations! They even accommodated a vegan friend. I always try to get one of their pan-fried noodles üçú
This place is small but everything is fresh and delish. Prices are fair and portions are huge. Didn‚Äôt wait long but it was a weekday.

Our go-to for Chinese food in Manhattan. Have been coming to Wo Hop for many years. Good food, great service, and a lot of fun. Plus the "atmosphere" is great. There's nothing like walking down those stairs!!
Make sure you go to The one in the BASEMENT !! Much better quality of food we tried  many dishes !delish !
One of the best Chinese restaurants in NYC. Great Cantonese menu and they serve big portions of food. Really enjoy this place.
Just be prepared for a wait but it‚Äôs worth it and bring cash they don‚Äôt take card here. Got chow fun with pork and egg drop wonton soup so good!!!
I love the fried rice üçö and the chow fun noodles üçú. The Peking pork was not to my liking. The meat was not crispy, and it was drenched in sauce. They drowned it in a sauce I didn't like.

So my family has been coming here for over 50 years, probably longer. The food is always top notch on freshness and flavor. Not much has changed here in my lifetime, the food is always delicious and you can't get authentic food like this in upstate NY. Only thing I would critique is that the black bean sauce on my snails could have been a lot spicier. We were a little confused why our server and another gentleman asked to bring out our appetizer 3 times (we replied yes all 3 times) but it never arrived, so we just chalked it up to them being busy. It was great to take my friend Sara here for her 1st time, and a nice trip down memory lane for me since I haven't been down in probably 10 years. Miss you Willie, different experience without you there. That man (prior owner) I owe my love of Chinese food to. Everything he made was the best thing I ever tried as a little kid, especially the sea snails, which I was taught to eat around 3y.o., and I been eating my own platter every time ever since üòÖüíõüêå

During high school. My cousins and I used to come here after midnight for munchies. I can‚Äôt believe it is still open. The amazing thing about this is they‚Äôre still open, still have the identical menu, the same wonderful glorious foods we used to eat and cozy up to! So I ordered the same exact dishes from decades ago and the memories from my past came true today. Been dreaming about returning here for the longest time. The food is amazing and as always everyone is so friendly. Reminder this is a cash-only restaurant for a heads up. Please enjoy this wonderful place. I will always come here to eat when in town. It is my favorite place to eat in Chinatown üíü

Wo Hop ‚Äì Classic Chinatown Spot with Delicious Food (Cash Only)

I recently visited Wo Hop, one of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Chinatown, and it did not disappoint. I tried the old-fashioned chow mein and shrimp dumpling soup. The portion sizes were generous, and the food was really yummy. I went on a weekday, so the line wasn‚Äôt long, and the service was quick. It‚Äôs important to note that Wo Hop is cash-only, so be prepared! The prices are reasonable, making it a great spot for a classic, hearty meal. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.
